intro: Conyza catharinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it produces small, white to yellowish flowers. Conyza catharinensis is an annual herb that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. It is known for its ability to thrive in various environmental conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
